tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE VPN_Client_Software_Updates (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  client_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  version VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  update_url TEXT,
  release_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE patches (
    patch_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    patch_name VARCHAR(255),
    patch_version VARCHAR(50),
    patch_description TEXT,
    release_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE vpn_clients (
    client_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    client_name VARCHAR(255),
    last_connection TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE software_updates (
    update_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    update_version VARCHAR(50),
    update_description TEXT,
    update_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE patches (
    patch_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    update_id INT,
    patch_version VARCHAR(50),
    patch_description TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (update_id) REFERENCES software_updates(update_id)
)

CREATE TABLE updates (
    update_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    update_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    update_version VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    update_date DATETIME,
    update_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE patches (
    patch_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    patch_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    patch_version VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    patch_date DATETIME,
    patch_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE clients_updates (
    client_id INT,
    update_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (client_id) REFERENCES clients(client_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (update_id) REFERENCES updates(update_id),
    PRIMARY KEY (client_id, update_id)
);

CREATE TABLE updates_patches (
    update_id INT,
    patch_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (update_id) REFERENCES updates(update_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (patch_id) REFERENCES patches(patch_id),
    PRIMARY KEY (update_id, patch_id)
);
